Class com.icl.saxon.NumberHandler 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.icl.saxon.ElementHandlerBase
           |
           +----com.icl.saxon.NumberHandler
public class NumberHandler
extends ElementHandlerBase
Class NumberHandler

An element handler that supports automatic numbering of elements within a document.

Elements of the defined type are numbered consecutively within the document starting at one. Numbering restarts at one within each instance of the specified base element type; if numbering is to be continuous, specify the root element as the base element type.

It the base element is also numbered, there is an option to concatenate the element numbers of this element with those of the base element.

The element number is generated in the form of a pseudo-attribute called "#". It may be accessed by calling getExtendedAttribute() with "#" as the attribute name, or by using textual substitution in the format() method invoked by ItemRenderer

NumberHandler(String, boolean)
Constructor supplies parameters to control numbering.

startElement(ElementInfo)
Handle start of element
This implementation generates a number.

NumberHandler 
 public NumberHandler(String base,
                      boolean concat)
Constructor supplies parameters to control numbering.

Parameters:
baseTag - An ancestor element to act as the nunbering base: numbers are reset to one when a new ancestor element occurs.
concatenate - True if numbers are to be concatenated with the numbers of the base element.

startElement 
 public void startElement(ElementInfo e)
Handle start of element
This implementation generates a number.
